reasons_to_visit.details: May arguably offers Athens' best weather: reliably sunny, pleasantly warm (average highs 25-27°C), ideal for exploring sites and enjoying outdoor activities without excessive heat.
Experience Athens adorned with spring flowers, including the spectacular purple bloom of the Jacaranda trees, often peaking in May. Parks and hills are lush and green.

reasons_to_visit.reason: Ideal for Sightseeing Before Peak Crowds
reasons_to_visit.details: While busier than early spring, crowds are generally more manageable than July/August. It's a great time to visit the Acropolis and museums with relatively fewer people.
The sea temperature warms significantly, making swimming pleasant for most by mid-late May. Perfect for enjoying the Athenian Riviera or nearby islands.
May often sees the start of summer festivals like the Athens Street Food Festival, Athens Jazz Festival, and the opening of open-air cinemas ('therina sinema').
Pleasant weather is ideal for day trips to archaeological sites like Delphi or Mycenae, or ferry trips to nearby Saronic islands like Aegina or Hydra.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: May is shoulder season moving into high season. Expect noticeable crowds and rising prices for flights and accommodation compared to earlier spring.
May 1st (May Day/Labor Day) is a major public holiday. Expect widespread closures and potentially large demonstrations or transport strikes impacting travel.
It's wise to book popular accommodations, Acropolis tickets (timed entry), sought-after tours, and ferry tickets (especially weekends) in advance.
Even if temperatures aren't extreme, the Mediterranean sun is strong. Sunscreen, hats, and sunglasses are necessary.
Late spring blooms mean pollen levels can be high, affecting allergy sufferers.

weather.precipitation: Low chance of rain, mostly sunny and pleasantly warm. Evenings are comfortable.
weather.general_tips: Pack light layers: t-shirts, light trousers/skirts, maybe a light jacket or cardigan for evenings. Comfortable walking shoes/sandals essential. Sunscreen, hat, sunglasses needed.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate to High, increasing. Busy around May 1st due to holiday/potential travel.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder/High season prices. Book ahead, especially around May 1st.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant late spring feel. Great weather for extensive exploration. Potential disruptions around May 1st.

events_holidays.name: May Day / Labor Day (Protomagia)
events_holidays.description: Major public holiday. Traditionally involves making flower wreaths ('stefania'). Often sees large demonstrations/marches in central Athens and potential transport strikes.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread closures (sites, museums, shops). Check transport status. Many Athenians head to countryside/beaches.

events_holidays.name: Athens Street Food Festival (Potential Start)
events_holidays.date: Often starts weekends in May (check dates)
events_holidays.description: Popular festival usually held over several weekends at the Old Depot OSY (Gazi), featuring diverse food stalls, music, and drinks.
events_holidays.notes: Check official dates and location annually. Entry fee applies.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the iconic site in ideal weather conditions, enjoying wildflowers on the slopes. Go early to beat crowds and midday sun.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book timed-entry tickets online in advance. Bring water, wear sun protection. Combine with Acropolis Museum.

unique_experiences.where: Various streets/squares (e.g., near Zappeion, parts of Kolonaki, Vasilissis Sofias Ave)
unique_experiences.description: Seek out streets lined with Jacaranda trees to admire their stunning purple blooms, typically vibrant in May.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ask locals for good spots or simply keep an eye out while exploring central neighborhoods.

unique_experiences.description: Take a tram/bus to the coast for swimming as the sea warms up, relax at a beach cafe, or visit Lake Vouliagmeni's thermal waters.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Beaches get busier, especially on weekends. Consider weekdays for more space.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the charming historic streets, browse souvenir shops, enjoy outdoor cafes, and discover the hidden island-like village of Anafiotika.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ideal for evening strolls as it cools down.

weather.precipitation: Very low chance of rain. Consistently sunny and warm, feeling like early summer.
weather.general_tips: Pack light summer clothing. Sunscreen, hat, sunglasses essential. Stay hydrated. Comfortable sandals recommended.

tourism_level.crowds: High and busy. Feels like summer season is beginning in earnest.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful early summer conditions. Lively evenings, ideal for outdoor dining, rooftop bars, and exploring.

events_holidays.name: Athens Jazz Festival
events_holidays.date: Usually late May / early June (check dates)
events_holidays.description: Major international jazz festival held at Technopolis (Gazi), typically featuring free concerts over several days.
events_holidays.notes: Very popular event. Check official program and schedule annually.

events_holidays.name: Open-Air Cinemas ('Therina Sinema') Open
events_holidays.description: Enjoy movies under the stars in traditional garden settings - a classic Athenian summer experience.
events_holidays.notes: Check listings for locations (Cine Thisio, Cine Paris etc.) and film schedules.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy free live jazz performances from Greek and international artists in a unique industrial setting.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check the schedule online. Can get crowded. Accessible by metro (Kerameikos station).

unique_experiences.description: Take a short ferry ride to the nearest Saronic island. Explore the main town, visit the Temple of Aphaia, relax by the sea, and try the famous Aegina pistachios.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Frequent ferries (conventional & hydrofoil). Book tickets ahead, especially weekends. Renting a scooter/car on island optional.

unique_experiences.activity: Hike Mount Lycabettus for Sunset Views
unique_experiences.description: Walk or take the funicular up for stunning panoramic views of Athens, the Acropolis, and the sunset over the sea.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes. Funicular entrance on Ploutarchou street. Cafe/restaurant at top.

unique_experiences.where: Various locations near Monastiraki, Syntagma, Plaka
unique_experiences.description: Experience Athens' famous rooftop bar scene with stunning Acropolis views, especially magical after dark.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Popular spots get very busy. Consider booking or arriving early. Prices higher than street level.
